content: The theory of relativity, E=mc^2, was proposed by which physicist, considered one of the greatest scientists of all time?

The theory of relativity, including the famous equation E=mc², was proposed by Albert Einstein, who is widely regarded as one of the greatest scientists in history. Einstein's work revolutionized physics and our understanding of space, time, and gravity. His contributions include both the special theory of relativity and the general theory of relativity, which have had profound impacts on modern science and technology.
